section.title: resource
section.para: resource command interacts with javax.slee.management:name=ResourceManagement Bean. It is standard SLEE MBean. resource command allows management of Resource Adaptor entities: create, remove, start, stop, update configuration,... . It supports following operations:

section.title: bind
section.para: bind operation creates binding between Resource Adaptor Entity and specific link(associates RA Entity to link). It does not take argument, however it requires options:

listitem.para: specifies link name to be used in bind operation. This name can be referenced in SBB descriptors. Requires argument. This option is mandatory.
specifies Resource Adaptor Entity name which will be bound to link. Requires valid entity name as argument. This option is mandatory.

section.title: unbind
section.para: unbind operation destroys binding created with operation. It does not support any options. It requires link name as argument.

section.title: activate
section.para: activate operation activates Resource Adaptor Entity. It does not support options. It requires entity name as argument.

section.title: deactivate
section.para: deactivate operation renders Resource Adaptor Entity inactive. It does not support options. It requires entity name as argument.

section.title: graceful-stop
section.para: graceful-stop operation renders Resource Adaptor Entity gracefully inactivation. This is an extended command. It does not support argument. It requires entity-name option to be present. If not specified 'ast' and 'time' argument, default are set (See Resource Adaptor's Configuration Properties in RA's documentation).

section.title: create
section.para: create operation creates new Resource Adaptor Entity. This operation does not activate created entity. It does not support argument, it requires all supported options to be present:

listitem.para: specifies entity name to be used for new Resource Adaptor Entity. Requires argument.
specifies ResourceAdaptorID to be used as ResourceAdaptorObject for new entity. Requires ResourceAdaptorID as argument.

Specifies ConfigurationProperties passed to ResourceAdaptorObject during configuration part of its life-cycle. Requires string representation of ConfigProperties. Config property has general form of: (name:java.type=value) and array has different form, than in components, members are separated with , : [(cnf.prop),(cnf.prop)]

example.title: Create SIP RA with empty config

section.title: remove
section.para: remove operation removes INACTIVE Resource Adaptor Entity. It does not support options. It requires Resource Adaptor Entity name as argument.

section.title: update-config
section.para: update-config operation updates configuration in specified entity. If new properties are verified by Resource Adaptor Object, old configuration properties are discarded and replaced with new set. This operation does not support argument, it requires options to specify entity name and new configuration properties. update-config supports following options:

listitem.para: specifies entity name to be used for new Resource Adaptor Entity. Requires argument.

Specifies ConfigurationProperties passed to ResourceAdaptorObject during confgiuration part of its lifecycle. Requires string representation of ConfigProperties. Config property has general form of: (name:java.type=value) and array has different form, than in components, members are separated with , : [(cnf.prop),(cnf.prop)]

section.title: list
section.para: list operation queries container for certain information and lists output. It does not support argument. It requires one of following options to be present:

listitem.para:
instructs operation to list Resource Adaptor Entities present in container. It supports optional argument. Argument is of ResourcedaptorID type, if its present, entities for this ID are listed.
List entities for SIP RA
./twiddle.sh resource -l --ra-entities=\ ResourceAdaptorID[name=JainSipResourceAdaptor,vendor=net.java.slee.sip,version=1.2]
instructs operation to list entities in certain state. Requires string representation of entity state as argument. Resource Adaptor can be in one of following states:
instructs operation to list Resource Adaptor Entity name(s) for given link name(s). Requires link name as argument, it accepts array argument:

instructs operation to list Resoruce Adaptor Entity links. It supports optional argument. Argument must be valid Resource Adaptor Entity name. If argument is specified, operation will list link names only for that specific entity.
instructs operation to list SBB IDs which declare reference Resource Adaptor Entity link. Requires link name as argument:

section.title: get
section.para: get operation fetches certain information from container. It does not support argument, it requires one option to be present:

listitem.para: fetches ResoruceAdaptorID. Requires Resource Adaptor Entity name as argument.
fetches state of certain entity. Requires Resource Adaptor Entity name as argument.
fetches default ConfigurationProperties for Resource Adaptor Object. Requires ResourceAdaptorID as argument.
fetches ConfigurationProperties for existing entity. Requires Resource Adaptor Entity name as argument.
